page.title: 13Great Corby
page.content: We continued our talk with the old lady from Great Corby. The River Eden is crossed from Wetheral to Great Corby by a viaduct carrying the railway line.There is a footpath which runs alongside the track.In her younger days one could use this footpath by paying 1/2d.For the same price you could cross by ferry.No payment was required on a Sunday if one was walking across the viaduct to the church in Wetheral. Coffins were put on a flat bogey and pushed across to the church.Roads to outlying farms were poor so corpses were brought along the valleys by the becks.bearers rested the coffins on flat stones called "Coffin Stones." There is a coffin stone in the playground of Great Corby School. This lady gardens,recently built a wall and is knitting for Famine Relief
